mission.title: Who We Are
mission.description: StudyFrontier is an international education consulting agency based in Kenitra, Morocco. We provide ethical, legal guidance to students seeking admission to accredited U.S. universities. Our mission is to make the application process transparent, manageable, and grounded in realistic expectations.

integrity.title: Ethical Standards
integrity.description: We adhere to all applicable education consulting regulations and operate with complete transparency.

expertise.title: Professional Guidance
expertise.description: Our team provides informed guidance based on experience with U.S. university admissions processes.

partnership.title: Student Support
partnership.description: We support students throughout the application process, from initial consultation to enrollment.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.description: We provide personalized consulting to each student based on their academic profile, financial circumstances, and educational goals. We believe in honest assessments and realistic pathways.

hero.title: Our Services
hero.subtitle: End-to-End Support for Your Study Abroad Journey

consultation.title: Initial Consultation
consultation.description: We begin with a comprehensive assessment of your academic background, goals, and financial situation. This helps us identify suitable universities and programs for your profile.

university.title: University Selection & Applications
university.description: Guidance on choosing appropriate institutions and preparing applications. We help you present your qualifications effectively to admissions committees.

admission.title: Admission Support
admission.description: From essays to recommendation letters, we ensure every element of your application meets U.S. standards and showcases your potential.

visa.title: F-1 Visa Preparation
visa.description: Comprehensive preparation for your visa interview, including documentation review, mock interviews, and embassy procedures guidance.

pathway.title: Pathway Programs
pathway.description: For students who need additional English language preparation or academic foundation, we connect you with accredited pathway programs designed for international student success.

predeparture.title: Pre-Departure Guidance
predeparture.description: Orientation on living in the U.S., housing options, cultural adaptation, and what to expect in your first semester.

process.title: A Clear, Step-by-Step Process
process.subtitle: From your first consultation to landing on campus, we guide you through every milestone.

step1.title: Discovery & Profile Assessment
step1.description: We evaluate your academic background, goals, and eligibility for US universities.

step2.title: University Matching & Selection
step2.description: Identify schools that match your profile, budget, and program interests.

step3.title: Application Preparation
step3.description: Complete applications, essays, recommendations, and required documents.

step4.title: I-20 Document Processing
step4.description: Receive your I-20 from your admitted university to begin visa process.

step5.title: F-1 Visa Preparation
step5.description: SEVIS payment, DS-160 form, interview preparation, and document review.

step6.title: Pre-Departure Support
step6.description: Travel planning, housing, orientation, and final preparations for your journey.

hero.title: Why StudyFrontier?
hero.subtitle: We don't promise miracles. We provide clarity, honesty, and expert guidance.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.p1: We are not a high-volume agency churning through applications. We are a consulting firm that works with students who are serious, prepared, and ready to invest in their future.
approach.p2: Our process is thorough. We assess your academic background, understand your goals, evaluate your financial readiness, and provide honest recommendations. If we don't think a US university is the right path for you right now, we'll tell you.
approach.p3: This approach means we work with fewer students—but our students succeed. They gain admission to accredited institutions, secure their F-1 visas, and thrive in their programs.

ethical.title: Ethical Standards First
ethical.description: We adhere to all Moroccan and international regulations. No shortcuts, no false documents, no guarantees we can't keep. Our reputation depends on doing this right.

realistic.title: Realistic Expectations
realistic.description: We match you with universities based on your actual qualifications and budget. Not every student is Harvard material—and that's fine. We find the right fit, not the most prestigious name.

professional.title: Professional Expertise
professional.description: We understand the US admissions system, F-1 visa requirements, and what success actually looks like. This isn't guesswork—it's experience.

quality.title: Quality Over Volume
quality.description: We work with a limited number of students each cycle. This allows us to provide the attention your application deserves, not rush through paperwork.

timelines.title: Proper Timelines
timelines.description: Studying in the USA takes 6-12 months of preparation. We don't promise overnight results. We walk you through each step at the appropriate pace.

success.title: Student Success Focus
success.description: Our job isn't just to get you admitted—it's to ensure you're set up to succeed once you arrive. We prepare you for the academic and cultural transition.

step1.title: Initial Consultation
step1.description: We review your academic history, English proficiency, budget, and goals. This is a two-way conversation—we assess if we're the right fit for each other.

step2.title: Honest Assessment
step2.description: We tell you where you stand. If your grades aren't competitive, we discuss pathway programs or gap year options. If your budget is unrealistic, we say so.

step3.title: Strategic University Selection
step3.description: We identify 5-8 universities that match your profile, budget, and goals. A mix of reach, target, and safety schools—all accredited, all legitimate.

step4.title: Application Preparation
step4.description: We guide you through essays, recommendation letters, transcripts, and test scores. You write your essays—we refine them. This is your application, told authentically.

step5.title: Financial Documentation
step5.description: We help you prepare bank statements, sponsor letters, and financial documents for I-20 issuance. Everything must be legitimate and verifiable.

step6.title: Visa Preparation
step6.description: We prepare you for your F-1 visa interview. Mock interviews, document review, and strategy. We know what the Casablanca consulate looks for.

step7.title: Pre-Departure Guidance
step7.description: Once you have your visa, we help with housing, course registration, travel planning, and cultural preparation. We set you up for success.

why.title: Why Our Students Succeed
reasons: They receive honest guidance, not false hope
They apply to universities that match their qualifications
They're financially prepared for the full cost of study
They understand the F-1 visa process and requirements
They're academically ready for US university rigor
They have realistic expectations about outcomes
They've invested time in proper preparation
They receive ongoing support, not just admission

cta.title: Ready to Work with Us?
cta.subtitle: If you're serious about studying in the USA and ready to invest the time and effort required, let's talk.

hero.title: Who We Work With
hero.subtitle: We're selective about the students we accept. Here's why—and if we're the right fit for you.

selective.title: Why We're Selective
selective.p1: Quality consulting requires focus. We work with a limited number of students each admissions cycle because we provide thorough, personalized guidance—not assembly-line service.
selective.p2: This means we need to ensure there's mutual fit. We need students who are academically prepared, financially ready, and genuinely committed to succeeding in the US. In return, you get our full attention and expertise.
selective.p3: If you meet our criteria, we'll invest significant time in your success. If you don't, we'll be honest with you—and may recommend alternative paths or timelines.

academic.title: Academically Prepared Students
criteria: Moroccan Baccalauréat with 12/20+ (14+ for competitive programs)
Or Bachelor's/Licence degree for graduate programs
Willingness to take standardized tests (SAT, GRE, TOEFL)
Demonstrated academic consistency across years

financial.title: Financially Ready Families
criteria: Minimum $25,000-$70,000 available for first year (depending on university)
Clear source of funds (family savings, property, business income)
Realistic understanding of 4-year costs for Bachelor's or 2-year for Master's
Ability to provide legitimate bank statements and financial documents

committed.title: Serious, Committed Students
criteria: Starting the process 8-12 months before desired enrollment
Willing to invest time in applications, essays, and test prep
Open to honest feedback about university fit and chances
Ready to follow our guidance and meet deadlines

english.title: English Proficient (or Willing to Be)
criteria: Intermediate English level minimum (can pursue pathway programs if needed)
Willing to take TOEFL/IELTS or complete ESL program
Able to communicate clearly in consultation meetings
Committed to improving English before program starts

realistic.title: Realistic About the Process
criteria: Understanding that no one can guarantee admission or visa approval
Willing to apply to multiple universities (not just "top 10")
Open to schools in different states and regions
Prepared for rejection and plan B options

items.title: Students Expecting Guarantees
items.description: If you want someone to promise admission to Harvard or guarantee visa approval, that's not us. No ethical consultant can guarantee these outcomes.

items.title: Last-Minute Applicants
items.description: If you want to enroll in 2-3 months, the timeline is too compressed. Proper preparation takes 6-12 months minimum.

items.title: Financially Unprepared Families
items.description: If you don't have the required funds now and no clear plan to obtain them, it's not the right time. We can't fabricate financial documents.

items.title: Students Seeking Shortcuts
items.description: If you want fake documents, guaranteed admission schemes, or ways to bypass visa requirements—we don't offer that, and neither should anyone else.

items.title: Students Only Targeting "Top 10" Schools
items.description: If you'll only consider Ivy League universities despite not having competitive grades/scores, we'll have difficulty finding suitable options.

items.title: Students Not Willing to Follow Guidance
items.description: If you want to ignore deadlines, skip steps, or not take our advice seriously, our process won't work for you.

items.title: Students Looking for Cheapest Service
items.description: If price is your only consideration and you're comparing based on lowest fees, we're probably not the best fit. Quality consulting costs money.

note.title: Important Note
note.description: These criteria are guidelines, not absolutes. If you're close but not perfect, contact us anyway. We'll have an honest conversation about your options—whether that's moving forward now, preparing for a future cycle, or exploring alternative pathways.

cta.title: Think We're the Right Fit?
cta.subtitle: Let's have an honest conversation about your goals, qualifications, and timeline.
cta.note: No obligation. No pressure. Just an honest assessment.

hero.title: Study in the USA from Morocco
hero.subtitle: Complete guide to US university admissions, F-1 visa process, costs, and requirements for Moroccan students

why.title: Why Study in the USA?
why.intro: The United States hosts over 1 million international students annually, making it the world's most popular study destination. For Moroccan students, US universities offer unparalleled opportunities in education, research, and career development.

worldClass.title: World-Class Education
worldClass.description: Home to 8 of the world's top 10 universities, including Harvard, MIT, and Stanford.

diverse.title: Diverse Programs
diverse.description: Over 4,000 universities offering programs in every field imaginable.

research.title: Research Opportunities
research.description: Access to cutting-edge research facilities and opportunities to work with leading professors.

opt.title: OPT Work Authorization
opt.description: Work in the US for 1-3 years after graduation through Optional Practical Training (OPT).

visa.title: F-1 Visa Process for Moroccan Students
visa.notice: F-1 visa interviews for Moroccan students are conducted at the US Embassy in Casablanca. Current wait times are approximately 2-4 weeks.

steps.title: Get Accepted to SEVP-Approved School
steps.description: Apply and receive admission from a US university approved by SEVP (Student and Exchange Visitor Program).

steps.title: Receive Form I-20
steps.description: Your university will issue Form I-20 (Certificate of Eligibility) after you pay the SEVIS fee and submit required documents.

steps.title: Pay SEVIS Fee
steps.description: Pay the I-901 SEVIS fee ($350) online at fmjfee.com at least 3 days before your visa interview.

steps.title: Complete DS-160 Form
steps.description: Fill out the Online Nonimmigrant Visa Application (DS-160) and upload your photo.

steps.title: Schedule Visa Interview
steps.description: Book your appointment at the US Embassy in Casablanca through the online system.

steps.title: Prepare Documents
steps.description: Gather all required documents including passport, I-20, financial evidence, and academic transcripts.

steps.title: Attend Visa Interview
steps.description: Appear in person at the US Embassy with all documents. Be prepared to explain your study plans and ties to Morocco.

steps.title: Receive Visa
steps.description: If approved, your passport with F-1 visa will be returned within 5-10 business days.

q1.question: Do you guarantee university admission?
q1.answer: We do not make guarantees. We provide professional guidance to help you prepare strong applications based on your qualifications and our experience with U.S. university admissions processes.

q2.question: Do you guarantee visa approval?
q2.answer: No. Visa decisions are made solely by the U.S. Embassy. We prepare you thoroughly for the interview and ensure your documentation is complete and accurate.

q3.question: What are your fees?
q3.answer: Our consulting fees vary based on the services you need. Contact us for a personalized consultation and transparent pricing structure.

q4.question: Which universities do you work with?
q4.answer: We partner with accredited U.S. universities across multiple states. The right institution depends on your academic profile, budget, and career goals.

q5.question: How long does the process take?
q5.answer: From initial consultation to university enrollment, the process typically takes 6-12 months, depending on application deadlines and visa processing times.

q6.question: Do you help with English language requirements?
q6.answer: Yes. We can connect you with pathway programs and ESL institutions if you need to improve your English before starting your degree program.
